𝗜𝗥𝗢𝗡𝗥𝗗𝗣 | Implementing the Microsoft Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) in Rust.  🔥 Super Hot!

┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🦀 Rust 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Implementing the Microsoft Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) in Rust.
📅 Created: Jul 2019 • Updated: Mar 2025

┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Uncompressed raw bitmap support
✅ Interleaved Run-Length Encoding (RLE) Bitmap Codec support
✅ RDP 6.0 Bitmap Compression support
✅ Microsoft RemoteFX (RFX) support
✅ Asynchronous I/O RDP client example
✅ Blocking, synchronous RDP client example


┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐⭐ 2K 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 95 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 40 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

IronRDP is a collection of Rust crates that provide an implementation of the Microsoft Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), with a focus on security. It offers support for various video codecs and provides examples of both asynchronous and synchronous RDP clients, showcasing its versatility in different application scenarios.

┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦
• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/Devolutions/IronRDP

┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉┉

tray-tui brings system tray functionality to the terminal, allowing users to interact with tray menus through an interactive tree-based navigation system. It is built using Rust and the ratatui library, providing a seamless TUI experience for managing system tray items and actions.

𝗚𝗥𝗢𝗢𝗩𝗬 | Transpiling Python code to JavaScript for client-side execution, particularly within the Gradio library.  🔥 Super Hot!

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐍 Python 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Transpiling Python code to JavaScript for client-side execution, particularly within the Gradio library.
📅 Created: Feb 2025 • Updated: Mar 2025

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Converts Python functions to JavaScript equivalents.
✅ Supports a subset of the Python standard library.
✅ Provides complete error reporting for unsupported Python code.


♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐ 75 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 6 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 2 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Groovy is a Python-to-JavaScript transpiler designed for use in the Gradio library. It converts Python functions into their JavaScript equivalents, enabling developers to write Python code that runs efficiently on the client-side. Groovy prioritizes clear error reporting for unsupported Python code, making it easier for developers to adapt their functions accordingly.

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦
• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/gradio-app/groovy

1Panel is a web-based control panel designed to simplify Linux server management. It offers features such as website deployment, an application store for easy installation of open-source tools, and focuses on security and reliability through containerization.

𝗕𝗨𝗡𝗦𝗧𝗘𝗥 | Compiling shell scripts into standalone, portable, and secure static binaries that can run in environments without a shell.  🔥 Super Hot!

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Compiling shell scripts into standalone, portable, and secure static binaries that can run in environments without a shell.
📅 Created: Jul 2024 • Updated: Mar 2025

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Compiles shell scripts to static binaries
✅ Transpiles shell scripts to Go code
✅ Aims for bash compatibility
✅ Provides improved error handling and messages
✅ Plans to introduce a module system with a package manager
✅ Will support .env files and static asset embedding
✅ Aims to support different shells and POSIX


✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

🍴 54 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 11 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Bunster is a shell compiler that converts bash scripts into Go code and then compiles them into static binaries. This allows the scripts to run in environments where a shell is not available, improving security and portability. Bunster aims to provide modern language features like improved error handling, a module system, and support for .env files.

✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧✧

HeyForm is an open-source form builder that simplifies the creation of engaging conversational forms. It offers a wide array of input types, smart logic, powerful integrations, and extensive customization options. Users can analyze data collected through insightful analytics and export results for further analysis.

𝗭𝗘𝗕𝗔𝗥 | Creating customizable and cross-platform taskbars, desktop widgets, and popups.  🔥 Super Hot!

◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🦀 Rust 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Creating customizable and cross-platform taskbars, desktop widgets, and popups.
📅 Created: Jun 2023 • Updated: Mar 2025

◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Cross-platform support (Windows, MacOS, Linux)
✅ Customizable desktop widgets
✅ Taskbar creation
✅ Popup creation
✅ Uses native webviews for widgets (lightweight alternative to Electron)
✅ Exposes system information via reactive providers (CPU, battery, etc.)
✅ Frontend framework agnostic (React, SolidJS, etc.)


◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐⭐ 1.6K 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 68 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 32 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Zebar is a Rust-based tool for creating customizable and cross-platform desktop widgets, taskbars, and popups. It leverages native webviews for lightweight widget rendering and exposes system information through reactive providers. Zebar supports various frontend frameworks, allowing users to build widgets with their preferred technology.

◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦

𝗕𝗔𝗜𝗧𝗥𝗢𝗨𝗧𝗘 | Detect vulnerability scans and mislead attackers by providing false positive results, acting as an early warning system and wasting attackers' time.  🔥 Super Hot!

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐹 Go 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Detect vulnerability scans and mislead attackers by providing false positive results, acting as an early warning system and wasting attackers' time.
📅 Created: Jan 2025 • Updated: Mar 2025

▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Easy Integration with Go, Python, and Javascript web frameworks
✅ Ready-to-use vulnerability/misconfiguration rules
✅ Configurable endpoints with custom status codes, headers, and response bodies
✅ Selective rule loading
✅ Alert integration with external systems


▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐ 333 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀

▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Baitroute is a web honeypot library designed to detect and mislead attackers by creating realistic, vulnerable-looking endpoints. It integrates seamlessly with Go, Python, and Javascript web frameworks and offers ready-to-use rules that can be configured to create custom decoys. The library aims to provide an early warning system for potential attacks and waste attackers' time by presenting them with false positive vulnerabilities.

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

The Microsoft Activation Scripts repository provides open-source tools for activating Windows and Office using various methods like HWID, Ohook, TSforge, KMS38, and Online KMS. It also includes advanced troubleshooting capabilities to assist users in resolving activation issues. The repository aims to simplify and streamline the activation process for Microsoft products.
